questions.question_text: A potentiometer is used to measure the potential difference across a resistor in a circuit. If the resistor is replaced with another of half the resistance and the rest of the circuit is unchanged, what happens to the potential difference across the resistor?
questions.explanation: The potentiometer measures the potential difference across the components of the circuit, which is determined by the source and not the resistance of individual components.

questions.question_text: An RC circuit with a battery, resistor and capacitor is connected. At the instant the switch is closed, what is the current in the circuit?
questions.explanation: At the instant the switch is closed, the capacitor behaves like a short circuit, so the current in the circuit is maximum.

questions.question_text: An object is rolling without slipping. Its kinetic energy can be represented as...
questions.explanation: For an object rolling without slipping, the total kinetic energy is the sum of its translational kinetic energy (1/2 mv²) and its rotational kinetic energy (1/2 Iω²).

questions.question_text: If the moment of inertia of a rotating body is doubled and its angular velocity is halved, then the angular momentum...
questions.explanation: Angular momentum (L) is the product of the moment of inertia (I) and angular velocity (ω). If I is doubled and ω is halved, their product remains the same.

questions.question_text: In an RC circuit, the time constant is the product of resistance and capacitance. If both the resistance and capacitance are doubled, what happens to the time constant?
questions.explanation: The time constant (τ) of an RC circuit is given by τ=RC. If both R and C are doubled, then τ becomes four times.

questions.question_text: Two resistors of resistances R1 and R2 (R1 < R2) are connected in parallel. Which statement is true about the equivalent resistance?

options.A: It is greater than R1 but less than R2
options.C: It is between the harmonic mean and arithmetic mean of R1 and R2

questions.explanation: For parallel combination, the equivalent resistance is always less than the smallest resistance and is between the harmonic mean and arithmetic mean of the resistances.

questions.question_text: A potentiometer wire has length L and resistance R. If the length of the wire is doubled by stretching, what happens to the potential gradient of the wire?
questions.explanation: The potential gradient is the potential difference per unit length. If the length is doubled, the potential gradient becomes half.

questions.question_text: For a body in rotational motion, which quantity remains constant if no external torque is applied?
questions.explanation: According to the law of conservation of angular momentum, if no external torque is applied, the angular momentum of a rotating body remains constant.

questions.question_text: In an RC circuit, if the resistance is doubled while keeping the capacitance constant, what happens to the charging time of the capacitor?
questions.explanation: The charging time of a capacitor in an RC circuit is directly proportional to the resistance. If the resistance is doubled, the charging time also doubles.

questions.question_text: What is the net torque acting on a body at rotational equilibrium?

options.B: Equal to the moment of inertia

questions.explanation: A body is in rotational equilibrium when the net torque acting on it is zero. This means that all the torques acting on the body cancel each other out.
